0.cdata!:
Apoyar la innovación y estimular la
            competitividad en Croacia

theme: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise support,Education for the knowledge economy,Infrastructure services for private sector development,Technology diffusion

abstracts.cdata!:
Croatia is the birthplace of scientists
            like Nikola Tesla, whose discoveries made it possible for
            mankind to use electricity in everyday life. And of Rudjer
            Boskovic, whose 18th Century studies inspired the field of
            electromagnetism and whose work improved the performance of
            the royal society's telescopes and strengthened the
            dome of St. Peter's Basilica in Rome. Croatian
            scientists are still making important contributions,
            although most have yet to boost the country's economic
            development. Croatia's experience shows that innovation
            policies focused on supporting business R&D and enabling
            the commercialization of public research can achieve
            tangible results in a relatively short period of time. This
            is of particular importance in times of economic crisis when
            budgets are constrained and when economies need to unleash
            innovation and productivity as new drivers of economic
            growth,' says Paulo Correa, World Bank task manager for
            the Science and Technology Project.
